Have you enabled sync on your sent folder?

To check;

  1. Press top left menu button
  2. Select email account
  3. Select manage folders (bottom left) > Sent folder
  4. Enable Sync

The below guide shows the steps related to push setup, but sync is displayed on the same page. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/configure-push-email-thunderbird-android

content:
Hi Ksands

Message downloads via imap are not deleted from the server.

If you however delete emails using the app, they will be deleted from the server, ie. moved to the servers deleted/trash folder. Permanent deletion would require you to empty the trash folder.

You can set how deletions are handled within the app. Settings > Account > Fetching Mail: [When I delete a message]

  • Do not delete from server
  • Delete from server
  • Mark as read on server

Did you manually add the server settings or use the automatically detected ones.

To re-assure yourself, perhaps double check Thunderbird on your phone is setup to use Imap and not pop. Look at settings > account > fetching mail > incoming server.

content:
Hi ksands

Emails deleted as you describe will be removed from the phone.

You will see ALL messages ONLY from folders that "Sync" or "Push" is enabled on. If sync is not enabled on a folder, the contained messages will not download.

To check the folders being synchronised. Navigate: Email account > manage folders > [folder name]

Regarding your question on the "Mark as read when deleted" option. This setting changes the email status to unread before moving it to the phone and servers deleted/trash folder.

You don't say who your email provider is! Imap on 143 for non TLS/SSL connections appears common. Using a secure connection is highly advised.
